body: Sure, @github can you detach from Tippr/Pillow? And re: bitbucket Pillowâ€¦ I didn't know there was a bitbucket Pillow, do you mean PIL?

Sorry, I wasn't clear enough:
When I find a new OSS project, I tend to go "up" the fork network on github. But is @Tippr/pillow where the main action is or here at python-image/pillow? So to avoid confusion for people (like me) trying to find out which repo to clone.

Now, that I (think) I understand better that pillow is just for redistribution of PIL, I am sure, I was mistaken and on bitbucket there is https://bitbucket.org/effbot/pil-2009-raclette no Pillow but "only" PIL. Sorry for that - I reworded my main text above.

This is where Pillow development happens. However, since it was originally located elsewhere and was probably forked by @Tippr from there, we have the "forked from @Tippr" message. And, Pillow is not a redistribution of PIL it's a fork.

So now - with all honor to @Tippr - it _might_ be a good time to ask @github to remove the "froked from.." message to avoid confusion. I know that this is possible (by contacting github).

If Pillow is a stand-alone fork, why is there the notice in the README to report issues to effbot/pil-2009-raclette? I thought that was the pre-fork upstream PIL. Well one explanation: It might be the case that both have not diverged so much and you can still pull patches/commits from upstream PIL (which is effbot).

Oh I am so confused :-/
Sorry to bother you.

Sure, is mentioning @github here enough to contact them? Or should I do something else? Re: the fork, it's not too complicated. Pillow is a "friendly" fork which means we try to collaborate with the original PIL. We have a policy such that if we make a non-packaging-related change (the fork was originally for packaging only) we try to ensure there is a related ticket or commit upstream.

I like your friendly fork :-) Today, I `pip install pillow`ed it worked very nicely on OS X. The dependencies are easily installed via homebrew.

Probably, you'll have to write a mail or contact @github otherwise (don't think the read every mentions here).
There is a tranfer ownership action available on the admin panel in the 'Danger Zone' section.  Should be here: https://github.com/Tippr/Pillow/admin

Transfer is something different. It's also possible but not via the
admin panel, to explicitly cut from the "forked from".
I am not sure if they always do this or if they need good reasons to do so.
